ARTICLE.TITLE: Canal Winchester/Carroll news: Style to a Tea canceled
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Anne Darling Cyphert

Correspondent

Traditionally, the Style to a Tea event is held the last Sunday of every September, but this year, due to COVID 19, the event is canceled. Organizers Kathy Benson Moling and Eileen Benson ask that regular attendees mark their calendars for Sunday, Sept. 26, 2021, at The Wagnalls Memorial in Lithopolis when they hope to host the next Style to a Tea.

The usually sold out event features a style show with models from the local community. Proceeds go towards scholarships for local high school seniors. A tea party, sandwiches, vendors, and door prizes are all part of the annual event, until this year.

BC district news

Two student organizations in the Bloom-Carroll Local School District are asking for the Board of Education to approve trips.

Superintendent Shawn Haughn recommended to the BOE approval of the High School Spanish Club trip Costa Rica, scheduled for April 2-10, 2021. He is also recommending approval of the 8th Grade Class to amend the dates of the Washington D.C. trip for the Class of 2024 from November 2020 to May 19-22, 2021. Pending approval, the class of 2024 and class of 2025 will travel together.

Haughn is also recommending the BOE approve the resignation of Jaynee Ziegler, elementary school music teacher with 50 years of service to the District.

Carroll yard sales

On Friday, Aug. 14, and Saturday, Aug. 15, the Carroll Community will be hosting its 19th annual Neighborhood Yard Sales. Sales will be held at various homes on Winchester Road, Carroll-Southern Road, Coonpath Road, Kauffman Road, Pine Hill Estates subdivision, Castlewood Drive, and more. The Village of Carroll also has yard sales on Center Street, North and South Beaver Street, Jeannie Drive and Coakley Road. An updated information sheet can be obtained at 4205 Carroll Southern Road on the day of the sale. Social distancing guidelines will be followed. Times are 8 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. There will be no early bird sales.

SJXXII Parish

Father Brian O’Connor, pastor of Saint John XXIII Catholic Church in Bloom Township, announced that in conjunction with the other Bishops of Ohio, Bishop Robert Brennan of the Columbus Catholic Diocese has given Catholics an indefinite dispensation from the obligation of attendance of Sunday Mass due to the continual upswing of the COVID-19 virus. To reach Father O’Connor, call 614-920-1563.

Please email news items to Anne Darling Cyphert at adcnewsservice@aol.com.
